page.title: 02Moseley Bog B'ham
page.content: Moseley Bog is believed to have had a Bronze Age settlement, but the only evidence are cracked stones. We are not sure of there use. In 1542 Moseley Bog appeared in history books when Matthew Boulton used the Great or Old Pool to help Sarehole Mill grind corn..The mill stream was not big enough to run the mill by itself. In 1768 Sarehole Mill was used for making blades and wire. In 1850 the mill was closed due to the discovery of steam power.The mill pool was drained. In 1980 somebody wanted to build houses on the Bog. There was a meeting and the council stopped the houses from being built. A few years ago the Nature Conservancy Council declared the Bog a site of scientific interest. Now the lower playing field at Pickwick is to join the Bog as a site of special scientific interest.
